title: unicode white-space problem in breadcrumb
body:
today I have a problem with space in breadcrumb which space in `<li>` breaks to new line

please change the
```
breadcrumb>li{display:inline-block}
```
to 
```
breadcrumb>li{display:inline-block;white-space: pre}
```

title: fixes #13375
body:
Add selectors to remove the bottom margin from tables that are inside a
.panel-collapse div

When using a table inside a collapse component, the margin-bottom of the table isn't set to 0 (as it is when using a table directly inside a panel) causing a ugly white space to appear below the table.

**Test case on JSBin:**
http://jsbin.com/koretoje/2/

Fixes #13375.

This is my first pull request, FYI.

title: table-bordered with tbody and no content = no border
added a variable to allow offsetting the top of the carousel control
body: We have a need to allow offsetting the carousel controls to the middle of a container.  This is an enhancement to allow people to override having the controls at the top.

title: Responsive font sizes
body:
I've noticed that Bootstrap doesn't change it font sizes between layouts.  Why is that?  For example, the H1 font size is 36px.  This seems fine on a desktop but is WAY too big on a mobile layout.  What was the reasoning behind not making the font sizes responsive?

And if I wanted to make them responsive, is that easy to do without modifying the Bootstrap source?  It seems like I would have to rewrite a lot of code in my main.scss in my own media queries in order to do this.  A related part of the problem is that, for example, the H1, H2, H3, etc font sizes are defined as calculated pixels:

```
$font-size-h1:            floor(($font-size-base * 2.6)) !default; // ~36px
$font-size-h2:            floor(($font-size-base * 2.15)) !default; // ~30px
$font-size-h3:            ceil(($font-size-base * 1.7)) !default; // ~24px
$font-size-h4:            ceil(($font-size-base * 1.25)) !default; // ~18px
$font-size-h5:            $font-size-base !default;
$font-size-h6:            ceil(($font-size-base * 0.85)) !default; // ~12px
```

If Bootstrap was using `rem`s then you could simply change the base font size in each media query and all headers (in this example) would automatically change size accordingly.

Anyways, just trying to figure out the best approach here and also am wondering why in the world font sizes would not be setup to be responsive...

title: v3.1.1: Collapsing Element Flashes in Safari 7
body:
Upon opening the collapsable element in Safari 7, after the opening animation completes the element quickly closes and opens up again. The closing animation also appears to not fire correctly; the element just closes without animating/with an accelerated animation. This is NOT an issue in version 3.0.3 and older.

This appears to be related to the height being set at "auto" at the end of the animation ("[dimension]('auto')", line 523 in unminified JS). Is there a reason this is being applied?

title: Increase .lead font-weight for better readability on mobile
body: For better readability on mobile devices. As it stands, lead text appears on mobile with a thin font that doesn't stand out against regular paragraph text.

title: Two or more panels can be opened in an accordion at one time by clicking the links before animation completes.
body:
Step 1. Navigate to this page: http://getbootstrap.com/javascript/#collapse
Step 2. Click on one of the links that trigger opening of the accordion sections (ie. Collapsible Group Item `#1`)
Step 3. Before the section's opening animation has a chance to complete (the one from 'Step 2' above) click on a different link to trigger opening a second panel (ie. Collapsible Group Item `#2`)

At this point you should see that you have two accordion panels open at the same time.

title: .pull-left/right & .text-left/right classes shouldn't get flipped for RTL?
body:
Refs #13445.
css-flip offers the `@noflip` directive to prevent it from flipping certain declarations.
/cc @mdo

title: dropdown-menu links padding hardcoded instead of using @padding-base-*
navbar-fixed-top can't click elements on android default browser
body:
Hi,

I noticed this issue with Bootstrap 3, where on my android default browser, when I scroll down a little, open the fixed navbar, and try to click a link or anything on it, it won't work. I believe the background of the dropdown is overlapping the list elements and anchors. So when you try to click, it is clicking the dropdown background somehow.

To replicate this, simply open your Android default browser, go to: http://getbootstrap.com/examples/navbar-fixed-top/, scroll down on the page a little, then expand the navbar and try clicking one of its links.

I noticed however, that this works on chrome for android.

title: Animated progress bar on doc site causing repaints every 10ms
body:
On http://getbootstrap.com/components/ the animated progress bar causes recalculate style / composite layers events every 10ms, regardless of whether the progress bar is visible in the current viewport.

Would be good to have a button to press in order to activate the animation, to avoid eating battery for no reason.

title: Repaint fixes
body:
Hey hey,
Applied translateZ / translate3d to fixed elements to prevent browser repaint when scrolling.

These changes were originally part of a Bootstrap reset I made called "Lil' B"
http://itsjonq.github.io/lil-b/

Also added a new mixin under vendor-prefixes.less - .translateZ(@z). This targets translateZ directly.
I initially wanted to use .translate3d to target the "Z" axis for the repaint fixes.. but I believe translateZ has IE9 whereas translate3d doesn't:

http://caniuse.com/transforms3d

Hope this helps!

For you guys:
https://pbs.twimg.com/media/Bl3XWPkIUAAm66k.jpg:large

title: fires closed.bs.alert *after* DOM detach() as per #12379
body:
As per #12379

Fires closed.bs.alert *after* element is removed from DOM.
Previously it fired while the element was still attached.

title: Improve affix-bottom behavior when document height is dynamic
body:
Hi, again!

This builds off of #13392 to make it so that an affixed element that relies on a bottom offset behave normally when there are changes that cause the document height to fluctuate.

Before:
 - [Preview](http://embed.plnkr.co/ycevC4uWnoySq1UAhyYv/preview)
 - [Code](http://plnkr.co/edit/ycevC4uWnoySq1UAhyYv)

After:
  - [Preview](http://embed.plnkr.co/JXNbNHrt364mps0Pkfpt/preview)
  - [Code](http://plnkr.co/edit/JXNbNHrt364mps0Pkfpt)

Determining the affix state is bundled into a separate method for correctness and so that it's slightly easier to understand (you can find an outline of how I understood the logic in the README for one of my plunks). Also, an element whose affix is determined to be `'bottom'` always has its offset set (instead of just bailing out when it has been determined that the affix hasn't changed). This is so that if the document height changes that the affix-bottom element ends up in the right place when the next `checkPosition` occurs.

Please check out the demo to get a sense of what I'm talking about. Change the document height with `+` and `-` and watch how the bottom affix toggles between `affix` and `affix-bottom` on master, but not on my branch. I've also checked how these changes affect the affix used in the bootstrap docs by building them locally and it all looks good on my end.

Thanks! Any feedback is appreciated. :smile:

title: Data API implementation of carousel conflicts with custom components
Tooltip arrow is not centered
body:
The placement of the tooltip arrow appears to get cached in some situations, meaning it won't always be centered. Please see a reduced test case: http://jsfiddle.net/ytD5t/8/
![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2069528/2751283/3fce9944-c8c0-11e3-9f2b-6d348fde31c7.png)

title: margin-bottom of a table isn't set to 0 when table is used inside a collapse component
body:
When using a table inside a collapse component, the margin-bottom of the table isn't set to 0 (as it is when using a table directly inside a panel) causing a ugly white space to appear below the table.

**Reduced test case on JSBin:**
http://jsbin.com/koretoje/2/

**Workaround**
Add the following line to your CSS
```css
.panel .panel-collapse .table { margin-bottom : 0; }
```
